evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: GAVIN NEWSOM, IN HIS OFFICIAL CAPACITY AS GOVERNOR OF THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA; STATE OF CALIFORNIA, Plaintiffs

extracted.value: Plaintiffs: Individual, described as State of California and Governor Gavin Newsom in his official capacity

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Attorneys for Plaintiffs: ROB BONTA, Attorney General of California; MARISSA MALOUFF, JAMES E. STANLEY, Supervising Deputy Attorneys General

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: 15. Plaintiff Gavin Newsom is the Governor of the State of California. In his capacity as Governor, Governor Newsom is the Commander-in-Chief of the California National Guard. Cal. Const., art. V, § 7.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Gavin Newsom, in his official capacity as Governor of the State of California

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: 16. Attorney General Rob Bonta is the chief law officer of the State of California and head of the California Department of Justice.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: 17. Defendant Donald Trump is the President of the United States. In his official capacity as such, he issued a Memorandum on June 7, 2025, directing the federalization of the National Guard.

extracted.value: Defendant: Donald Trump, in his official capacity as President of the United States

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: 18. Defendant Peter Hegseth is the Secretary of Defense and head of the Department of Defense. On June 7 and June 9, 2025, Secretary Hegseth issued Memoranda ordering California National Guard members into federal service.

extracted.value: Defendant: Pete Hegseth, in his official capacity as Secretary of Defense

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: 19. Defendant U.S. Department of Defense (DOD) is a department of the executive branch of the United States government, responsible for coordinating the activities of the United States' armed forces, including the National Guard when under federal control.
